meanings.definition: Resembling a blob; having a shapeless, rounded form.
meanings.sent1: The blobby cloud floated lazily in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her blobby drawing of a cat was cute.
meanings.sent3: The blobby snowman looked like a melting marshmallow.
meanings.sent4: The blobby shadows cast by the trees danced on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The blobby pillow was so soft and squishy.

meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of blobs.
meanings.sent1: The cake was decorated with colorful blobby frosting.
meanings.sent2: His shirt was stained with blobby ink spots.
meanings.sent3: The blobby paint splatters on the wall created a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: The blobby patterns on the fabric reminded her of a modern art piece.
meanings.sent5: The blobby texture of the mud made it hard to walk through.

meanings.definition: To make or become blobby in appearance.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally blobbied the paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the colors began to blobby together.
meanings.sent3: The rain caused the colors to blobby and mix on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The heat made the wax blobby and drip down the candle.
meanings.sent5: The ice cream started to blobby in the sun.
